Grouped_Utterances: I guess I’m just worried about my upcoming disability hearing. It’s been weighing on my mind.

Well, I’ve been trying to focus on the positive aspects, but the nerve damage in my hand is still a challenge. It can get frustrating, especially when I’m trying to work. I’ve been trying to meditate more regularly. It helps, but some days are harder than others. I feel more centered and relaxed, but sometimes I struggle to quiet my mind. It’s like my thoughts just keep racing. I’ve been trying to stay busy, but it’s hard not to think about it.

Hi! I've been okay, you know, just trying to keep my spirits up despite everything. I’ve had a few small gigs, but nothing major. It’s tough finding paid work right now. I think it’s a combination of things—my health issues, and the competition in the industry. Sometimes I feel like I’m not good enough. I haven’t done much networking lately. I guess I’ve been feeling a bit isolated since the stroke. I feel a little nervous, but also excited. It’s been a while since I’ve reached out to someone in the industry. Yes, I think it will help me feel more connected again. It’s been good, but I think I need to give them a bit more space. Sometimes I feel like I’m relying on them too much. I’ve always wanted to try painting again. It could be a nice way to express myself. I’m feeling more hopeful just thinking about it.

I’ve been following the guided meditations from Deepak Chopra. I find his voice calming, and it helps me focus. Yes, I’ve tried that. It does help a bit. I just have to remind myself it’s okay to have those thoughts. Maybe I could write down my feelings or talk to someone about it.

That sounds doable. I can start with an old client I enjoyed working with. I could start by planning some activities for myself—maybe join a class or a group. Yes, I think I will! It might help me meet new people too. Yes, I think that would help me process everything.
